If we knew how, we'd probably stop cutting. That said, love, support, understanding, and patience. It also helps to find a substitute activity. Get her a nail file?
"Yep. I'll definitely do it after ten minutes."
Going into debt to get rid of my facial hair and it ***not working*** makes me want to go full Silence of the Lambs and do some basement skin swaps. So I feel you.
I'm in this image but nobody fucking cares so I should shut the fuck up.
My mom's late husband yeeted by cop when she had an affair with my dad. I'm stuck until she passes because unfortunately she fucking loves me and I don't wanna hurt her more than I have already.

I didn't put my deadname and got hired at two different places (Ross/office depot) I ended up having to get in contact with hr to get my first checks changed cuz I couldn't cash them. I can't pass thought so itvwasnt all that surprising to the hiring managers.
Sadly, this is why I moved to Washington state. Quality health care, less hurdles. Good luck!
At least you're near Raleigh. I had to live in Fayette-nam.
I feel you as someone that got drug fucking camping and hiking today after a 4 day yeet streak. My thighs are so raw...
Sometimes I'd rather have sliced thighs than a hangnail. I hate cuticles.
It's just a pool full of razors and alcohol with a cheese grater slide going into it.
Oh fuck ya! New way of getting ripped.
I want my insurance to cover the once. I guess we're both disappointed.
My mom's 56. She's in great shape though. I'm happy for her but it crushes me that I'm pretty much just waiting for her to die so I can follow her to the grave.
I sure hope I don't ring up as anything more expensive than $3.50. I'm not worth it.

WRITING.TITLE: Will they take my meds?
WRITING.TEXT: So I've been careening through some bad times lately. I swear my bipolar depression has gotten more intense and I could really use help. Obviously, I should go to a health professional. I don't have a therapist and with the world ending I doubt now is a good time to try shopping around. So I'm stuck with my primary (who I've seen once). I didn't mention I was bipolar when I got on hrt through informed consent. I wanted past the gate. I'd like to see if an antidepressant would help but I don't want to risk losing my transition because some doctor thinks it's my hormones. I also don't know if that's something only a mental health professional can prescribe. my mom's anti doctor (I saw maybe 4 growing up. I probably need some shots I've missed tbh) so I'm a bit inexperienced when it comes to the healthcare system. Any advice would be nice.
This makes a lot of sense and was explained wonderfully. Thank you for your help.

If I could pass flower through my phone, I'd help you out. I caught myself in this today. I was carving "failure" into my leg and after I was done I just went over it again and again until something in me told me I was finished and could go shower.
If it's bleeding, you hit styro. Even a drop of blood, that's the anatomy of skin.
Do you mean "they're darker red around the edges" by "shitty margherita pizza"? That's just bruising that is red because the blood is oxygenated.
I'm the cracked bin at a thrift store in Alabama that was previously for a mens bathroom of a bar.
Summer is cancelled this year because I cannot wear shorts.

I've had this thought before. Just blowing up my life so I can push myself past that edge. I never do it because I don't want to be homeless, suicidal, and still not do it. I've compromised and tell myself I'll end up doing it in the parking lot so those fuckers are the ones finding my body. I still end up just going to work though...
Fuck. Can I trade my job for friends or some mental stability?

My mom is in this wheelhouse. The loss of a 25 year marriage, the relapse of her first born, and the fact she's got two other kids gt;25 stuck at home again has destroyed her. She falls into a day of deep depression at least once a week now. She can push it away with exercise for a short time, but usually later that day or tomorrow it's gotten her again. It doesn't stop it, just delay it. She has rods in her back and a failing hip. This day to day fight to force endorphins into her brain is making her miserable in top of everything else. Depression is a complicated topic.
"If someone doesn't like you it's because they think you're better than them." Yep, this is the "forget haters" mentality in a nutshell. Idiots suck this crap up...
Did your Endo offer you prescribed injections? I doubt the black market stuff is more potent than the insurable stuff.
*heavy breathing noises
"Sure, but I'll be collecting further payment when you get in the shower."

You're going to lose muscle. If you work your butt off, you'll keep a lot of it but you will undoubtedly lose some muscle. It will probably be enough to make competing with men nearly impossible for a contact sport such as hockey. I'm sorry to be a pessimist. I'm not a medical professional but I've been on hrt almost a year now. So please take my thoughts with some salt.

I would watch him very carefully. If you could convince him to get a trigger lock that you hold the key for, that would be ideal. The turnaround mood change is what worries me. I own a handgun. I've put it to my head many times. The only time I really thought I was gonna do it was when I got this strange calm over me. I'd thought about doing it earlier in the day and had accepted it. Luckily my mom was in the other room and she pulled me out of it without really knowing what I was about to do. I'm sorry you're in this situation.

You're welcome, I don't pretend to be an expert but I try. I can't advise staying or leaving. They both have their pros and cons. Don't think you have to stay because he may do it. You're not responsible and you have limits too. If he will let you control the gun, that's a great thing. He seems to want to live but knows he's just gotten a very dangerous toy. He's willing to accept accountability and that's good. So if you choose to stay, keep the key on you, unless you're asleep, then find a good spot to hide it. If you don't sell the gun, I'd actually go to a range once in awhile. Try and get him (and you) to associate it less with this and more with recreation. He probably impulse bought the gun. Change is a trigger for many and, personally, getting a new job is a big source of anxiety. This can drive abnormal behavior. As changes become normalised things can improve. Unfortunately, life gives no guarantees. I really hope things improve for the two of you.

I've had some hard realisations of my own. I wanted to head a large, influential organization or a bleeding edge engineering department. (Basically, have power over influential people or technologies) I got a lot of the education but finding someone to hire a trans woman is hard when most of the field is men. They want people that come off as powerful and I don't. Also, a lot of men won't accept a female manager. I haven't given up my goal but I narrowed my scope. I don't think I'm going to head googles RND department but I may make my own company that builds important things. I'm just gonna have to work harder. You very well could be a goalie. I've seen accountants play 3rd string and successfully compete in that position. (Scott Foster, FTW!) If you're working to stay in the game, you could get damn good at shot blocking. Someone may sign you. If you get old and that never happens, you could kill it at your local co-ed adult games. I have a cis girl friend that plays hockey with men from her community college. She kicks butt too. I hope you get to realize your dream of hoisting the Stanley cup and letting your dress go spinny.
I'm so happy for you. That is remarkable support from family.

Oh they were having a buy one get one sale at my rite aid. I stocked up on gauze and antibiotic I already cut a lot so I like having it on hand. I don't even use gauze unless I feel my cut "deserves" it or if I've got a large area bleeding. I might use a bandaid if it's constantly stinging when it touches my pants leg. I'm fucked up tbh.

Oh shit. I feel this so bad. I yeet on my thighs so it makes it so much worse when I *do* cave.

That's what I was saying. They were something I considered an asset
Ha! Like my legs are still that smooth.
I was being sarcastic. My legs are not like that. They are *fucked* up with marks.

I've fantasized about palming a hot pan so much lately. This had me sweating a bit, ngl

I have this feeling a lot when I go out, though I'm usually alone or with my mom. I'm 24 so it's really hard to feel confident like that. I'm happily transitioning, but I'm far from where I'd like to be. It's hard to see women walking around being beautifully put together and I'm not.

Totally. I have breasts. They fill an A cup. All I really see in the mirror is a guy with puffy nipples. I hate it and I envy the blind in those moments.
I'd let the witch quit and get a therapist that doesn't try and play games. If she wants to stop doing therapy, she should stop doing therapy.

Oh fuck. House was an inspiration to me. Probably not in a good way though, he just had such a great flavor of sarcastic pessimism with just a hit of nihilism. I couldn't help but mirror him and try to be a brutally honest but capable asshole myself. If you haven't picked up 13 reasons why, don't, it's got some fucked up bits but personally I found it boring. Not really sh, but sui is prevalent.

I had inklings I'd want to at 14, held off a year before really entertaining the idea. Then I struggled to get the confidence to tell my family for 3 years. It took me another 3 to get to a place (literally, I had to move) where I could do it. I really wish I'd mentioned it earlier. Your mom's right in being hesitant but it would behoove the both of you to get outside, professional help.

I'm on the "abuse pills" and "seek out high risks" part of my rollercoaster

Ooh, I'm sorry. I *really* try to stay away from my hair cause it's the only thing I get compliments on. (Not many but meh.) Caught myself trying to burn my scalp with my hairdryer after I dissociated (fuck mirrors). I flipped out and almost broke the dryer by throwing it into the tub.

I hate drinking. Particularly because last time I got plastered I also got my recovering alcoholic of a brother drunk and he's totally relapsed now. I'm such a shit person. Misery wanted company and I got it. If the us weren't shut down I'd be in the work/party phase.
Only if my upcoming sui attempt works. Hopefully 740 mgs of oxy is is enough for cardiac arrest.
Sadly, all I can suggest is "don't read the letter" If she wants to be phobic, she can do that alone.

I'm not saying cut her out completely, just don't engage with the homophobia. If she tries to send you another letter like that, tell her that you don't want to have that conversation. You clearly have different beliefs than her. Let her know you're not interested in guilt or Bible verses and that if she tries to do that again, you're going to have to distance yourself. Not necessarily no contact. Let her know you won't open her letters if you feel they'll be filled with homophobia. She'll be forced to call you and it's a bit harder to guilt someone when they can respond in real time. I'm sorry you have to deal with this.
A lot of them are staffed by volunteers. They don't know fuck all to do about us.
Beans and Forbidden beans are the same. Fascia is under fat. Then it's muscle.
"Oh look! A reminder if just how far is be ***if I weren't such shit!***"" Is how I see this situation.

Exactly. Most regional ones are unpaid so the only real incentive is to pad a CV. I hate the corporate culture we all live in now where we must keep a documented record of our achievements in order to get a job that will sustain ourselves. I don't much care for farming, but I'd rather do that than all this other bs.
Damn, that's well worded.
Death is better than ambivalent "care"takers. Sorry, not a fan of institutions.

It takes me awhile to eat at friends houses. I don't know why but I'm always paranoid they're going to unknowingly give me food poisoning. I'm weird. WRITING.TITLE: How is your he dmv not essential?!
WRITING.TEXT: I had to man a cash register through the whole shutdown at office depot and you're telling me three months later I still can't finish my name change at the DMV because they're mostly closed. Appointments are booked out so far I might as well move states. Get a mask. Get a screen. Go to work like the rest of us. Why should I pay taxes for services im unable to use?! Edit: sorry for the typo. Also, wow! Way more attention than I expected. Fun fact! With only 14 dmv's open in the state, each one is responsible for roughly 543,928 people. There's 7.6 million people in Washington. We deserve better than this.
Tbh. That's one reason I want to update my Id

It won't even let me make an appointment because it only lets me set it within the next 30 days. Even in Wenatchee. Why does my office depot and my Ross still do business near our previous standards but the DMV doesn't. They do paperwork. I can stay 6 feet away. It's cleaner than a clothing store.
No. I'm doing a name change. I *have* to go in person. I've already called.
Yep. It's all ass covering and no consistent logic.
Not ever situation is the same. Why do I have to show up for work at office depot to sell chairs in a pandemic? I was deemed essential. Do the same with the DMV.
A) not all of them. B) most of the them are now booked weeks out. Why do I have to work through a pandemic selling shit behind a counter but these guys can't sit behind a desk and do the same?

Yes, because all of these businesses have been so responsible. Also assume I do have a grievance with my stores protocols. Who can I complain to when the courts are closed. I pay taxes. I have a right to complain about the double standards applied to the services I need to use vs the services Im obligated to supply if I want to eat. If my job weren't classed as essential, I'd have been allowed to stay home and collect ui. Instead I risked it everyday because of our governments chosen protocols. Is I really so much to ask for consistent logic?

Somewhat fair solution if the goal is not having anybody accomplish tasks. I could be a grocery store worker. Actually essential. Can't really close those. It seems odd to me that cashier's we're perfectly fine letting them risk getting exposed behind their screens but these public employees are somehow more valuable.
Yes, shitty typo.
Only reason I clicked on it tbh.

Calm down Jethro. Nobody voted for this. It's a policy decision guided by everyday idiots that got *hired*. Sure, you could fault our governor for responding to the pandemic poorly. Our other choice was in 2016. Inslee is better than the guy who's only focus was traffic congestion on the bridge near Medina. ^(thinking about it, Bill Bryant would probably have *loved* making everyone stay home. Quieter) If you want to leave then leave. Unlike the communists you compare us to we believe in open borders
Ah, you're one of the "labor over lives" people. Have a day.

You're a very ostentatious person. I didn't say shit about small business owners. I said we haven't had an election with Inslee in it since 2016, unless you count his failed presidential bid. Which Washingtonians didn't support. Your stance is uninformed so you still to attacking my character. I don't need to do that. I can simply let my statements stand and let you destroy your position in what's now considered Trumpian fashion. Have a day
No, Richard Spencer did when he actually began using it at neo Nazis rallies.
As much as I'd love to fuck up my arms, i have jobs that require short sleeves as a uniform. Fuuuu
In the beginning it plummets but it comes back after a few months. That's me though, some people react a bit differently
Tbh, roughly the same but I wouldn't know too well. I don't masturbate much cuz of dysphoria and nobody has wanted me since I started hrt. :/

You know, denialism isn't a solution, it's an excuse. He has a surprisingly large influence. The "OK" sign *in certain contexts* means white power because this fucking guy uses it to start his rallies. If Trump started making the Spock sign at the starts of his rallies, it would no longer mean live long and prosper to everyone. To some, it would mean, "build the wall. Stop the gays. Support Trump " Money is made mostly through influence. Denying that is to deny reality.

Oh. Some subreddits don't like him. Oooooh. So convincing. That doesn't translate to him not having power. Did you forget he was an organizer of the Charlottesville protests or are you too stuck on Reddit politics to pay attention to the real world? You want to call me a rube for taking something seriously? Do you even know what the word *means*? Most of Richards supporters are gullible country boys. I'm not country. I'm not gullible. And I'm not a boy. 0/3 Spencer's not just racist, he's a purist. Obvious racists aren't his only supporters. Many hardcore white supremacists don't like his views because he doesn't believe whites are *inherently* better, he just wants every culture to remain separate. Even if it means crafting policy to force that to happen. You should read more than memes before you try to argue a point.

You can make assumptions off my post history or you can debate. My character and state of mind doesn't change my arguments validity. Richard Spencer is a sizeable threat to modern Democracy. He would have us devolve back into Jim Crowe. I'm not supporting the twit, I'm saying don't just dismiss Spencer as a nobody. Well over a million people have been influenced by him and to deny that is to deny reality. The "OK" symbol is being coopted by white supremacists. Removing it from CoD may prevent it's spread under certain conditions. It's stupid if they just removed it from a cutscene. Assuming it's a gesture you can freely do. It could be something racists start doing when they kill a black character instead of "teabagging". (Also a stupid practice) This catches on and suddenly the conversation happening on Xbox with 8 year olds is, "no, if they're black you do this." I highly doubt 4chan started the gesture takeover. Even if they did, Spencer is definitely the reason it's an issue today.

No, but since you went ahead and brought up him, he also coopted symbolism. The Swastika is a Hindu religious symbol usually meaning "good luck" but I bet if you saw a person walking down the street wearing that pattern you would look twice. We live in a time where white supremacists are attempting to take common symbols. Removing it from a place they historically shelter themselves (Video Games) is a simple way of slowing the spread.
You're not debating because you have no argument. Sharpening mine is never a waste of time, even if it's only against tin.

If you'd read thoroughly you'd see where I typed the phrase, "in certain contexts". Spencer's gotta start somewhere. He can't really say, "I'm not a Nazi" then do the Sieg Heil but he sure as fuck can go "okay" and smile when the response is his crowd Sieg Heiling back . All I said was that 4Chan didn't really popularise OK as white supremacism. Richard did. Denialist Reddit has to get angry though when their assumptions are challenged I guess.
Same here. I found I have to stand up real slow and, as others here said, keep a bit if TP handy.

These feelings are why I abhore going shopping. Fucking beautiful people make me so jealous. I hate myself for it but I can't really help myself

Can we stop gatekeeping with people's healthcare. Particularly when many countries don't have adequately managed healthcare systems in the first place. Hell, pretty sure you picked one of the more common ages people begin that anyways but if they weren't allowed to even start the process until 25 you'd doom every transgender person to a life where they undergo both of their puberties before they can start the one they wanted because *some* people might be wrong. Before you get on my back, yes, I think under 18 should have additional rules but adults should be allowed to inform themselves and consent. Insurance is already a big enough pain to deal with. I reiterate. Please leave your arbitrarily created guidelines to yourself.

WRITING.TITLE: You can't get a concealed carry anymore in king county
WRITING.TEXT: According to rcw 9.41.070 this is violating our 2nd amendment rights. They have 30 days to process an application of any person who's a resident. They won't fingerprint you currently though, so they're not issuing new ones. This seems discriminatory based on your county. If I were in a different county I could get a concealed carry but because king county is closed I can't. If you can fingerprint my brother to put him in jail, you can fingerprint me to run my background. I'll wear a mask. Also, in the legislation, it specifically says, "a political subdivision of the state shall not modify the requirements of this section or chapter" It seems that is a lie. Anyways, rant over.
They're down for three hours. They gave warning earlier. Please don't spread the URL too much. We've been getting some trolls lately.
Ah, didn't know. I'm dumb
This is why I don't visit those people.
Oh I fuckin hate this feeling when I get up.
I've been ghosted out of so many friend groups at this point I swear I should change my name to Casper. So I get these feels.
When I was in high school, closeted, this was my life.
Oh, I'm more like Cassie the pessimistic asshole. I just liked the easy reference of Casper.

WRITING.TITLE: I hate my birthday
WRITING.TEXT: TW: I'm a vulgar person. The whole damn month and September too. I hate my mom asking me what I want to do for it every year. Like I can respond with anything. I really want a party. With friends. There's the fucking caveat. Cake is easy. Friends are impossible when you've moved across the damn country your entire childhood. How can I say that the only thing I want is friends? To be in a group and not become the third wheel that gets dumped off at some point. There's no store for that. Im so alone. It's been years since I've had anyone even give a shit about me and my birthday is a rude reminder every year. Getting that happy birthday text from my sister sucks. Scrolling up four messages and seeing the same message from last year and the year before that is depressing as hell. Every year I start making plans to kill myself but I never do it. I don't want to be another year older. Have to embrace another year of failure. Another year of anxiety about life and the obviously worsening global climate, both literal climate and political. I don't see anybody wanting to be with me and that's honestly a good thing. I'm a 25 year old pessimistic shut-in that cuts herself. Darwin has a theory about me.
To be fair, serfdom is just slavery under a different name.

Serfdom is a system where peasants were indentured to the land they lived on, getting traded like appliances that come the house. Many of them weren't allowed to breed without their lords permission. Serfdom is slavery to the land you're on and whomever owns it. In fact, serf is just an old term for slave.

Gotta tell you, having someone tell me, "do this work or I'll beat you to death" is slavery. Regardless of the amount of additional "rights" I get. Some slaves in the US had more rights than others. Were they any less a slave? Hell, you could buy your freedom. Then your father's. Then your wife's. https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Berry_Meachum The only difference between slavery and serfdom is property law. Are slaves part of the real estate or are they personal property to be taken when you move.
Dude, I need this

I live in WA. $49 a month for health insurance. $5 copay for my endo. $0 prescriptions (I take generics so I don't pay $25) Which state you live in is important. When I was in NC, planned parenthood was my only hope and they had insane waits. The closest one was 2 1/2 hours away.
It's funny it's got a viewport tbh
Oh shnitzel! I daydream about my death at the slightest issue. Can't find my keys? Death. Allergies? Please be covid. Another weekend alone? "Hey Google, nearest overpass."

I feel I gotta point out, this is exactly why Britain doesn't let their day to day street cops walk around with pistols.
Yes. Not in small part because they don't carry them. I just find it odd that people can't acknowledge the advantages with the disadvantages.
No, but I do believe we should try to discourage arms proliferation. This isn't the sub for that discussion though.

No. Yet another false assumption. I think they carry guns because it's easy. Not every criminal carries one either, usually they're more trouble than they're worth. But you don't care what I think, you've formed your opinion and will stick to it like glue.

Yep, the "well, what are we gonna do about it now" excuse. Gotta tell you, buyback programs work, and Australia is a good example. They're more Southern than our Southern. Also, I lived in two southern states for 9 years. There's actually quite a few people in the south that aren't obsessed with guns. It's not "take their guns" it's, "make it harder for a 20 yo pissed off kid with nothing to lose to get an assault rifle." But sure, I'm advocating for the removal of the second amendment, not common sense gun legislation. Everybody's an extremist in assumption land.
Australia and most of the rest of the developed world disagrees with you. But sure, keep swallowing that talking point. Keep believing that because something is *difficult* it's *impossible*.

You can make as many excuses against change as you want, it doesn't make the objective facts about America's gun violence problem any less real or any less of an actionable issue. Just because you don't believe America has the capability to change, doesn't mean everyone does. Australia has *less* guns and *less* gun deaths. By a huge margin. So does New Zealand. Good "perfect solution" fallacy there though. Just because it's not perfect doesn't mean it's not better.

I'm not saying ban guns. Find where I said that (that wasn't sarcastic). I've pointed this out twice now. I said make them less prolific. Less easy to attain. Perhaps a license to carry one, like driving. Your idea that "if someone comes at me with a knife, I'll get my gun" is a lot less reasonable when you realize most knife attackers will be in range before you know they've got a knife. And all you've done by proliferating firearms is make that knife attacker more likely to come at you with a gun instead. Also, it's harder for a kid to steal your knife and kill five classmates. Or an unarmed person to come up behind you and suddenly be very much armed. Yet again, if it's not perfect solution, it's not acceptable you. Not even worth considering even if you can see other people utilizing the solution effectively. Our constitution used to say women couldn't vote and alcohol was illegal. We changed that. Perhaps allowing militia groups isn't the best idea. Australia is an equivalent to America. Making the assumption that we can't do what they did because we have more people is not logical. Why can California institute large societal changes so much quicker than the rural states then? If you try to say "we have laws that stop that" again, I'll simply point out the capacity for change, so get another argument.

I just said this. Capacity. For. Change. You need a license to practice law. It's just having an argument but you need to pass a test to do it professionally. Not every right is guaranteed without restriction. Parade organizers need licenses to organize. So do protesters in many places. Are you married? How was the line getting your marriage license. You need building permits to construct on your own land. Guns aren't special. They're just like everything else, an object or action that can be reasonably regulated.
